info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 5:54PM EDT until September 08 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Greene County in east central New York... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 554 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Coxsackie to near Milton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hudson, Catskill, Chatham, Claverack, Coxsackie, Athens, Philmont, Kinderhook, Lorenz Park, Claverack-Red Mills, Ghent, Stockport, Stuyvesant, Stuyvesant Falls, Hamburg Light, Jefferson Heights, Burden Dock, Columbiaville, Greenport Center and Mellenville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
